thread.title: Popovich to coach US Olympic basketball team after Coach K
thread.title_full: Popovich to coach US Olympic basketball team after Coach K

author: BRIAN MAHONEY AP Basketball Writer
title: Popovich to coach US Olympic basketball team after Coach K
text:
Popovich to coach US Olympic basketball team after Coach K Popovich to coach US Olympic basketball team after Coach K By BRIAN MAHONEY AP Basketball Writer Oct 23, 2015 Comments 
Gregg Popovich, who has led the San Antonio Spurs to five NBA titles, will replace Mike Krzyzewski as the U.S. basketball coach following the 2016 Olympics. 
USA Basketball said Friday that Popovich will take over starting with 2017 training camp and lead   2019 Basketball World Cup and 2020 Olympics if they qualify. 
Regarded as one of best coaches, Popovich was the choice when USA   decided to return to an NBA coach. Krzyzewski has led the Americans since 2005. 
The Duke coach has guided the Americans to consecutive Olympic gold medals and two world titles. He will stay on as a special adviser to Colangelo. 
Popovich was a U.S. assistant in the 2002 world championships and 2004 Olympics, the low point of U.S. basketball. Colangelo was hired to assemble   following the bronze medal in Athens. He selected Krzyzewski as his coach after also considering Popovich. More Headlines
